title: Please consider tagging a vibecoding griefpost or hypepost as a rant
description:
Many of us going through the five stages of grief about AI.

But processing our collective trauma is neither practices nor programming.

And people have left because we're not talking about computing! (e.g.)

Some rules of thumb for great stories to submit: Will this improve the reader's next program? Will it deepen their understanding of their last program? Will it be more interesting in five or ten years?

Glancing at the front-page and /top/1w … are "munching away my passion", "to not vibe code", a "loss of identity", or "the thing I loved has changed" great stories?

I do not want to shut down the conversation. Rather, let's continue it in the right space: the rant tag!

(And pro-AI posts should be tagged rant too; it is for "rants and raves")
description_plain:
Many of us going through [the five stages of grief](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Five_stages_of_grief) about AI.

But processing our collective trauma is neither `practices` nor `programming`.

And people have left because we're not talking about computing! ([e.g.](https://mastodon.social/@tef/116023657636125934))

> Some rules of thumb for great stories to submit: Will this improve the reader's next program? Will it deepen their understanding of their last program? Will it be more interesting in five or ten years?

Glancing at the front-page and /top/1w … are "munching away my passion", "to not vibe code", a "loss of identity", or "the thing I loved has changed" great stories?

I do not want to shut down the conversation. Rather, let's continue it in the right space: [the `rant` tag](https://lobste.rs/t/rant)!

(And pro-AI posts should be tagged `rant` too; it is for "rants _and raves_")

title: A relationship between the Collatz conjecture and the Fibonacci numbers
description: Hi all, it seems I discovered a previously unknown relationship between the Collatz conjecture and the (signed) Fibonacci numbers. I would be super grateful for any feedback. Thank you!
description_plain: Hi all, it seems I discovered a previously unknown relationship between the Collatz conjecture and the (signed) Fibonacci numbers. I would be super grateful for any feedback. Thank you!

Error payloads in Zig
Please implement combination tags for more precise filtering
description:
TLDR: Please implement this pull request: Add Combination Filters

There are a lot of "Woe is me, I'm a programmer and AI is interfering with feelings" posts lately. Can we please get these tagged as (culture || philosophy) + vibecoding instead of just vibecoding? The current tagging system makes them impossible to filter out separately from vibecoding related technical content. I went so far as to make a pull request to support this functionality because despite people having feelings and those feelings actually mattering - I don't want to read them. I work with computers so I don't have to deal with feelings, mine or anyone else's. I just want to make stuff and talk with people about new ways to make stuff, not discuss existential crises.

Stories tagged vibecoding but what I consider underusing tags:

  • AI is slowly munching away my passion
  • A Single Reason To Not Vibe Code
  • An AI Agent Published a Hit Piece on Me – More Things Have Happened

Better tag usage

  • A programmer's loss of identity culture and vibecoding

  • Workledger - An offline first engineering notebook just vibecoding

I believe the PR will be useful for other purposes aside from just my own.
description_plain:
*TLDR: Please implement this pull request: [Add Combination Filters](https://github.com/lobsters/lobsters/pull/1907)*

There are a lot of "Woe is me, I'm a programmer and AI is interfering with feelings" posts lately. Can we please get these tagged as (culture || philosophy) + vibecoding instead of just vibecoding? The current tagging system makes them impossible to filter out separately from vibecoding related technical content.  I went so far as to make a [pull request](https://github.com/lobsters/lobsters/pull/1907) to support this functionality because despite people having feelings and those feelings actually mattering - I don't want to read them.  I work with computers so I don't have to deal with feelings, mine or anyone else's.  I just want to make stuff and talk with people about new ways to make stuff, not discuss existential crises.

Stories tagged vibecoding but what I consider underusing tags:

- [AI is slowly munching away my passion](https://whynot.fail/human/ai-is-slowly-munching-away-my-passion/)
- [A Single Reason To Not Vibe Code](https://asindu.xyz/a-single-reason-to-not-vibe-code)
- [An AI Agent Published a Hit Piece on Me – More Things Have Happened](https://theshamblog.com/an-ai-agent-published-a-hit-piece-on-me-part-2/)

Better tag usage
- [A programmer's loss of identity](https://ratfactor.com/tech-nope2) culture and vibecoding

- [Workledger - An offline first engineering notebook](https://about.workledger.org/) just vibecoding

I believe the PR will be useful for other purposes aside from just my own.
